sen.j: 青山 忠敏（あおやま ただゆき）は、丹波国篠山藩の第6代（最後）の藩主。
sen.e: Tadayuki AOYAMA was the sixth lord (the last) of the Sasayama clan in Tamba Provimve.
Tadayuki AOYAMA was the sixth lord (the last) of the Sasayama Domain in Tanba Province.
sen.cmt: ・"clan"を"Domain"にしました。・"Tamba"を"Tanba"に、"Provimve"を"Province"に訂正しました（スペルミス）。
sen.e: Tadayuki AOYAMA was the sixth lord (the last) of the Sasayama Domain in Tanba Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: The twelfth generation of the head family of the AOYAMA family
He was the twelfth generation of the head family of the AOYAMA family.
sen.cmt: ピリオドがついておらず、文の形になっていなかったので、文にしました。
sen.e: He was the twelfth generation of the head family of the AOYAMA family.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天保5年（1834年）2月21日、第5代藩主・青山忠良の次男として江戸で生まれる。
sen.e: He was born the second son of Tadanaga AOYAMA, the fifth lord, on February 21, 1834.
He was born as the second son of Tadanaga AOYAMA, the fifth lord, on March 30, 1834.
sen.cmt: ・bornのあとにasをおぎないました。・グレゴリオ暦にしました。
sen.e: He was born as the second son of Tadanaga AOYAMA, the fifth lord, on March 30, 1834.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 嘉永3年（1850年）12月16日、従五位下・因幡守に叙位・任官する。
sen.e: He was given the Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank) and was appointed the Inaba no kami on December 16, 1850.
He was given Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and was appointed as the Inaba no kami (a governor of Inaba Province) on January 17, 1851.
sen.cmt: ・"Junior Fifth Rank"のあとに"Lower Grade"を補いました。・「因幡守」の説明を補いました。・グレゴリオ暦にしました。
sen.e: He was given Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and was appointed as the Inaba no kami (a governor of Inaba Province) on January 17, 1851.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 文久2年（1862年）2月29日、父が病気を理由に隠居したため、家督を継いで第6代藩主となった。
sen.e: He succeeded the family estate and became the sixth lord on February 29, 1850 after his father's retirement due to his illness.
He succeeded the family headship and became the sixth lord of the Sasayama Domain on March 29, 1862 after his father's retirement due to his illness.
sen.cmt: 「家督を継いで」を、以下のウェブサイトを参考に書き換えました。http://www.csse.monash.edu.au/~jwb/cgi-bin/wwwjdic.cgi?1E ・"lord"のあとに"Sasayama Domain"を補いました。・グレゴリオ暦にしました。
sen.e: He succeeded the family headship and became the sixth lord of the Sasayama Domain on March 29, 1862 after his father's retirement due to his illness.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 幕末期の動乱の中では、譜代大名の名門のため佐幕派として行動し、文久3年（1863年）8月、二条城守備を務めた。
sen.e: He joined the Sabaku party (supporters of the Shogun) during the disturbance at the end of the Edo Period because he belonged to the Fudai Daimyo (daimyo in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family), a family of pedigree, and he served as a guard for the Nijo-jo Castle in August, 1863.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He joined the Sabaku faction (supporters of the Tokugawa family) in the disturbance at the end of the Edo Period because he was born in a family of pedigree of a Fudai Daimyo (Japanese feudal lord in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family), and he served as a guard for the Nijo-jo Castle in September, 1863.
sen.cmt: ・"party"を"faction"にしました。・用語集には"supporters of the Shogun"とありますが、文脈から"shogun"を"Tokugawa family"に書き換えたほうがわかりやすいと判断し、そのようにしました。・「譜代大名の名門」の部分の訳を変えました。・グレゴリオ暦にしました。
sen.e: He joined the Sabaku faction (supporters of the Tokugawa family) in the disturbance at the end of the Edo Period because he was born in a family of pedigree of a Fudai Daimyo (Japanese feudal lord in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family), and he served as a guard for the Nijo-jo Castle in September, 1863.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 元治元年（1864年）5月には従四位下に昇叙され、7月の禁門の変にも出兵した。
sen.e: He was promoted to the Jushiige (Junior Fourth Rank) in May, 1864 and joined the force during Cospiracy of Kinmon.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was promoted to Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) in June 1864 and dispatched his troops when Hamaguri rebellion happened in August.
sen.cmt: "the Jushiige (Junior Fourth Rank)"という記載を、用語集に従い訂正しました。・グレゴリオ暦にしました。・「出兵」を"dispatch his troops"と訳しました。・「禁門の変」の訳はウィキペディアと下記ウェブサイトに従い"Hamaguri rebellion"を採用しました。http://www.csse.monash.edu.au/~jwb/cgi-bin/wwwjdic.cgi?1F
sen.e: He was promoted to Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) in June 1864 and dispatched his troops when Hamaguri rebellion happened in August.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 8月9日には左京大夫に遷任される。
sen.e: He was appointed to the Sakyodaibu (Master of the Eastern Capital Offices) on August 9.
He was appointed Sakyo no daibu (Master of the Eastern Capital Offices) on September 9, 1864.
sen.cmt: ・the SakyodaibuをSakyo no daibuに訂正しました。・グレゴリオ暦にしました。
sen.e: He was appointed Sakyo no daibu (Master of the Eastern Capital Offices) on September 9, 1864.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 元治2年（1865年）1月20日、奏者番に任じられる。
sen.e: He was appointed the Sojaban (official in charge of the ceremonies) on January 20, 1865.
He was appointed to Sojaban (official in charge of the ceremonies) on February 15, 1865.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦にしました。
sen.e: He was appointed to Sojaban (official in charge of the ceremonies) on February 15, 1865.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 慶応4年（1868年）1月からの戊辰戦争では、藩内で佐幕派と尊王派が争った。
sen.e: During the Boshin War started in January 1868, the Sasayama clan was divided into two parties, the Sabaku and the Sonno parties, and they fought each other.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the Boshin War from January 1868, the Sasayama clan was divided into two factions, the Sabaku and the Sonno, and they fought each other.
sen.cmt: ・"during"を"in"にしました。・startedをfromに変え、partyをfactionに変えました。
sen.e: In the Boshin War from January 1868, the Sasayama clan was divided into two factions, the Sabaku and the Sonno, and they fought each other.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 結局は西園寺公望ら新政府軍が侵攻して来ると新政府に降伏し、五箇条の御誓文の席にも参列した。
sen.e: In the end, Tadayuki surrenderred to the New Government when the New Government Army led by Kinmochi SAIONJI raided the Sasayama-jo Castle and furthermore, he attended the meeting when the Imperial Covenant Consisting of Five Articles was announced.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the end, Tadayuki surrendered to the New Government when the New Government Army led by Kinmochi SAIONJI invaded the Sasayama-jo Castle, and furthermore, he attended the meeting when the Imperial Covenant Consisting of Five Articles was announced.
sen.cmt: ・"surrenderred"を"surrendered"に訂正しました（スペルミス）。・raidedをinvadedに変えました。
sen.e: In the end, Tadayuki surrendered to the New Government when the New Government Army led by Kinmochi SAIONJI invaded the Sasayama-jo Castle, and furthermore, he attended the meeting when the Imperial Covenant Consisting of Five Articles was announced.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 明治2年（1869年）6月19日、版籍奉還により篠山藩知事に任じられ、明治4年（1871年）7月14日の廃藩置県で免職される。
sen.e: He was appointed to the Mayor of the Sasayama clan due to the Hansekihokan (return of lands and people to the emperor) on June 19, 1869 and he was dismissed from the position due to the Haihanchiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures) on July 14, 1871.

He was appointed to the Mayor of the Sasayama Domain due to the Hanseki-hokan (return of lands and people to the emperor) on July 27, 1869 and he was dismissed from the position due to the Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures) on August 29, 1871.
sen.cmt: ・"Clan"を"Domain"にしました。・グレゴリオ暦にしました。・Hansekihokan、Haihanchikenの区切りにハイフンを挿入しました。
sen.e: He was appointed to the Mayor of the Sasayama Domain due to the Hanseki-hokan (return of lands and people to the emperor) on July 27, 1869 and he was dismissed from the position due to the Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures) on August 29, 1871.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: He moved to Tokyo in September.
He moved to Tokyo in October.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦にしました。
sen.e: He moved to Tokyo in October.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: He died on March 21, 1873.
He died on March 21, 1873.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He died on March 21, 1873.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: His age at death was 40 years old.
He was 40 years old when he died.
sen.cmt: こちらのほうが自然かと思い、書き換えました。
sen.e: He was 40 years old when he died.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 男子がなかったため、家督は弟の忠誠が継いでいる。
sen.e: Since he did not have a son, the family estate was succeeded by his younger brother, Tadashige AOYAMA.
Since he did not have a son, family headship was succeeded by Tadashige, his younger brother.
sen.cmt: family estateを。下記ウェブサイトに従いfamily headshipに変えました。http://www.csse.monash.edu.au/~jwb/cgi-bin/wwwjdic.cgi?1F）
sen.e: Since he did not have a son, family headship was succeeded by Tadashige, his younger brother.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
